items.sentence: Tom has three sons, and they all look a lot like him.
Who was the one who translated that poem into French?
You've bought more postage stamps than are necessary.
I lent him some money, but he hasn't returned it yet.
You shouldn't have done that without asking me first.
I did everything the way we agreed it should be done.
Are you sure you want to spend three weeks in Boston?
Are you sure you want to let Tom continue to do that?
I haven't heard from Tom since he moved to Australia.
Tom is probably not going to do that tomorrow either.
Tom is probably not ever going to be able to do that.
Tom is probably not going to be back by October 20th.
Tom is probably not going to walk to school tomorrow.
I thought that you used to teach French in Australia.
Tom likely noticed that Mary wasn't paying attention.
I think that Tom will be glad that's going to happen.
What's the most convenient way to get to the airport?
Tom and Mary canceled the party they'd been planning.
When was the last time that you lied to your husband?
You'll have to open the box to find out what's in it.
